page.title: 06PLACE NAMES (GOLLANFIELD)
page.content: Here are some local {Place Names}and what they mean. { { Gollanfield }-Field of Mr.Gollan who was the original owner. {Balspardon }-Bal means farm-{Spardon {Farm. { Easter Glackton }-Glac means valley, the buildings are on a hill but the farm goes into a valley. {Muir and Loch of the Clans -Prince {Charlie's army of Clansmen}camped there the night before the{Battle of {Culloden. {Torbreck }-Our school used to be called Torbreck and it is on a sandy hill. {Blar Nam Fiadh -Moorland of the Deer, It is beside a moorland with deer. {Mains of Balnagowan }-It is a farm but in {Gaelic }it means a {Blacksmiths.
